content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's the implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col, ' \t\n\r\0'))

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, " ", "_")
    col = replace(col, "-", "_")

    return col
end
```

This function performs the required transformations on the column name as specified in your question.
